briefdescription.para: keyword for files to load

Construct an additional ParmParse object sharing the same internal table as any other such objects in existence. If prefix is specified, load this string as the code prefix for this particular ParmParse object. If parser_prefix is specified, it will be used as prefixed in math expression evaluations.
Returns true if name is in table.
Returns the number of values associated with nth occurrence of name (prepended with the prefix) in the table. n == -1 implies the last occurrence.
Returns the number of times the given name (prepended with prefix) appears in the table.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, bool &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: getkth

briefdescription.para: Get the ival'th value of kth occurrence of the requested name. If successful, the value is converted to a bool and stored in reference ref. If the kth occurrence does not exist or ival'th value does not exist, or if the printed representation of the value cannot be converted to an bool, an error message is output and the program halts. Note that ival == 0 is the first value in the list. ParmParse converts the value 'true', and non-zero integers or floats to bool(true), and bool(false) for 'false' or zero integer or float values.
Same as getkth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, bool &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: querykth

briefdescription.para: Similar to getkth() but returns 0 if there is no kth occurrence of name. If successful, it returns 1 and stores the value in ref. If the kth occurrence exists, but ival'th value of that occurrence does not, or if there is a type mismatch, then the program signals an error and halts.
Same as querykth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.
Add a key 'name' with value 'val' to the end of the PP table.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, int &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: getkth

briefdescription.para: Get the ival'th value of kth occurrence of the requested name. If successful, the value is converted to an int and stored in reference ref. If the kth occurrence does not exist or ival'th value does not exist, or if the printed representation of the value cannot be converted to an int, an error message is output and the program halts. Note that ival == 0 is the first value in the list.
Same as getkth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, int &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: querykth

detaileddescription.para: Similar to getkth() but returns 0 if there is no kth occurrence of name. If successful, it returns 1 and stores the value in ref. If the kth occurrence exists, but ival'th value of that occurrence does not, or if there is a type mismatch, then the program signals an error and halts.

briefdescription.para: Same as querykth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.
Add a key 'name' with value 'val' to the end of the PP table.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, std::string &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: getkth

briefdescription.para: Get the ival'th value of kth occurrence of the requested name. If successful, the value is converted to a std::string and stored in reference ref. If the kth occurrence does not exist or ival'th value does not exist, or if the printed representation of the value cannot be converted to a std::string, an error message is output and the program halts. Note that ival = 0 is the first value in the list.
Same as getkth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, std::string &ref, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: querykth

briefdescription.para: Similar to getkth() but returns 0 if there is no kth occurrence of name. If successful, it returns 1 and stores the value in ref. If the kth occurrence exists, but ival'th value of that occurrence does not, or if there is a type mismatch, then the program signals an error and halts.
Same as querykth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.
Add a key 'name' with value 'val' to the end of the PP table.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to get() but store the whole line including empty spaces in the middle if present as a single string. For example, foo = a b c is treated by this function as a single string "a b c", whereas get() will give only "a" and getarr() will store the results in std::vectcor<std::string>. Note this does not preserve the number of empty spaces, because of how ParmParse parses the line. For example, a b c with two spaces between b and c will become "a b c".

Similar to query() but store the whole line including empty spaces in the middle if present as a single string. For example, foo = a b c is treated by this function as a single string "a b c", whereas query() will give only "a" and queryarr() will store the results in std::vectcor<std::string>. Note this does not preserve the number of empty spaces, because of how ParmParse parses the line. For example, a b c with two spaces between b and c will become "a b c".

memberdef.name: getkth

If the kth occurrence does not exist or ival'th value does not exist, or if the printed representation of the value cannot be converted to a IntVect, an error message is output and the program halts. Note that ival = 0 is the first value in the list.
Same as getkth() but searches for the last occurrence of name.

briefdescription.para: Similar to getkth() but returns 0 if there is no kth occurrence of name. If successful, it returns 1 and stores the value in ref. memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int k, std::vector< int > &ref, int start_ix=FIRST, int num_val=ALL) const
memberdef.name: getktharr

briefdescription.para: Gets an std::vector<int> of num_val values from kth occurrence of given name. If successful, the values are converted to an int and stored in the std::vector<int> object ref. ref is resized (if necessary) to hold num_val values. The value in the list indexed by start_ix is copied into std::vector<int>[0], std::vector<int>[1] holds start_ix+1, etc. If the kth occurrence does not exist or there are fewer than start_ix + num_val values associated with the kth occurrence, or if some of the values cannot be converted to an int, an error message is reported and the program halts.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, std::vector< int > &ref, int start_ix=FIRST, int num_val=ALL) const
memberdef.name: getarr

briefdescription.para: Same as getktharr() but searches for last occurrence of name.

memberdef.name: queryktharr

briefdescription.para: Same as queryktharr() but searches for last occurrence of name.2.
Add a key 'name' with vector of values 'ref' to the end of the PP table.
Query RealVect from array.
Get RealVect from array.

If name is found, the value in the ParmParse database will be stored in the ref argument. If not, the value in ref will be added to the ParmParse database. The return value indicates if it existed previously.

If name is found, the value in the ParmParse database will be stored in the ref argument. If not, the value in ref will be added to the ParmParse database. The return value indicates if it existed previously.

detaileddescription.para: If name is found, then the ref argument will be reallocated (and resized) according to the number of values in the inputs.

briefdescription.para: If name is found, the value in the ParmParse database will be stored in the ref argument. If not, the value in ref will be added to the ParmParse database. The return value indicates if it existed previously.

If name is found, the value in the ParmParse database will be stored in the ref argument. If not, the value in ref will be added to the ParmParse database. The return value indicates if it existed previously.

Query with Parser. If name is found, this uses amrex::Parser to parse the entire list of empty space separated values as a single scalar. The return value indicates whether it's found. Note that queryWithParser will be used recursively for unresolved symbols.

Query with Parser. The return value indicates whether it's found. Note that queryWithParser will be used for unresolved symbols. If the number of elements in the input does not equal to nvals, it's a runtime error.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int nvals, long long *ptr) const
memberdef.name: queryarrWithParser

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int nvals, std::vector< T > &ref) const
memberdef.name: queryarrWithParser

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

briefdescription.para: Query with Parser. If name is found, this uses amrex::Parser to parse the entire list of empty space separated values as a single scalar. If not, the value in ref will be added to the ParmParse database. The return value indicates whether it's found.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

briefdescription.para: Get with Parser. If name is found, this uses amrex::Parser to parse the entire list of empty space separated values as a single scalar. If not, it's a runtime error.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

briefdescription.para: Get with Parser. If name is not found, it's a runtime error. If the number of elements does not equal to nvals, it's also a runtime error.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, int nvals, std::vector< T > &ref) const
memberdef.name: getarrWithParser

briefdescription.para: Get with Parser. If name is not found, it's a runtime error. If the number of elements does not equal to nvals, it's also a runtime error.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_same_v< T, bool >||std::is_same_v< T, int >||std::is_same_v< T, long >||std::is_same_v< T, long long >||std::is_same_v< T, float >||std::is_same_v< T, double >, int >

briefdescription.para: Get using two names.

detaileddescription.para: This function queries with new_name first, If it's not found, it will try again with old_name. It's an error if neither name is found.

briefdescription.para: . Query enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. The return value indicates if name is found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be converted to an enumerator (i.e., the string does not match any names in the definition of T).
Add a key 'name' with value 'val' to the end of the ParmParse database. Here T is an AMREX_ENUM type.

briefdescription.para: . Get enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. It's a runtime error, if name is not found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be converted to an enumerator (i.e., the string does not match any names in the definition of T).

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, std::vector< T > &ref, int start_ix=FIRST, int num_val=ALL) const
memberdef.name: queryarr

briefdescription.para: Query an array of enum values using given name.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, std::vector< T > &ref, int start_ix=FIRST, int num_val=ALL) const
memberdef.name: getarr

briefdescription.para: Get an array of enum values using given name.
. Query enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. The return value indicates if name is found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be case-insensitively converted to an enumerator (i.e., the found string, not name, does not case-insensitively match any names in the definition of T). If there are multiple matches, the first one is used.

briefdescription.para: . Get enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. It's a runtime error, if name is not found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be case-insensitively converted to an enumerator (i.e., the found string, not name, does not case-insensitively match any names in the definition of T). If there are multiple matches, the first one is used.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, T &ref, std::string_view const &ignores, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: query_enum_sloppy

briefdescription.para: . Query enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. The return value indicates if name is found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be case-insensitively converted to an enumerator (i.e., the found string, not name, does not case-insensitively match any names in the definition of T). If there are multiple matches, the first one is used. Characters in ignores will be ignored as if they don't exist in the value part of ParamParse entries (e.g., name = value).

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, T &ref, std::string_view const &ignores, int ival=FIRST) const
memberdef.name: get_enum_sloppy

briefdescription.para: . Get enum value using given name.

detaileddescription.para: Here T is an enum class defined by AMREX_ENUM. It's a runtime error, if name is not found. An exception is thrown, if the found string associated with the name cannot be case-insensitively converted to an enumerator (i.e., the found string, not name, does not case-insensitively match any names in the definition of T). If there are multiple matches, the first one is used. Characters in ignores will be ignored as if they don't exist in the value part of ParamParse entries (e.g., name = value).

briefdescription.para: Query T with Parser, but treat the number as double precision during parsing.

detaileddescription.para: The final result is cast to T. It may result in a runtime error if the conversion is not safe. T is either arithmetic type or std::optional of arithmetic type.

briefdescription.para: Query T array with Parser, but treat the number as double precision during parsing.

detaileddescription.para: The final result is cast to T's. It may result in a runtime error if the conversion is not safe. T is either arithmetic type or std::optional of arithmetic type.

briefdescription.para: Get T with Parser, but treat the number as double precision during parsing.

detaileddescription.para: The final result is cast to T. It may result in a runtime error if the conversion is not safe. T is either arithmetic type or std::optional of arithmetic type.

briefdescription.para: Get T array with Parser, but treat the number as double precision during parsing.

detaileddescription.para: The final result is cast to T's. It may result in a runtime error if the conversion is not safe. T is either arithmetic type or std::optional of arithmetic type.

briefdescription.para: Remove given name from the table.

detaileddescription.para: Make Parser using given string func as function body and vars as variable names. Constants known to ParmParse will be set. It's a runtime error, if there are unknown symbols in func.
Make IParser using given string func as function body and vars as variable names. Constants known to ParmParse will be set. It's a runtime error, if there are unknown symbols in func.

briefdescription.para: Query vector of vector. The return value indicates whether it's found. The table (i.e., vector of vector) is in the format of {{a00, a01, a02...} {a10, a11, a12...} ...}.
Get vector of vector. It's an error if it is not found. The table (i.e., vector of vector) is in the format of {{a00, a01, * a02...} {a10, a11, a12...} ...}.

Construct an initial ParmParse object from the argc and argv passed in to main(). An error will be signalled if another ParmParse object currently exists. If parfile is specified, read the parameters in from that file first and then append those derived from argv to the table.
The destructor. The internal static table will only be deleted if there are no other ParmParse objects in existence.
Set prefix used by math expression Parser.
Write the contents of the table in ASCII to the ostream.

detaileddescription.para: Write all entries in the table in a pretty way to the ostream. If there are duplicates, only the last one is printed.
Write unused inputs in a pretty way to the ostream. If there are duplicates, only the last one is printed.
Write used inputs in a pretty way to the ostream. If there are duplicates, only the last one is printed.

briefdescription.para: Add keys and values from a file to the end of the PP table.
Any unused [prefix.]* parameters?
Returns unused [prefix.]* parameters.
Returns [prefix.]* parameters.
Parse Parameters From Command Line and Input Files.

detaileddescription.para: The ParmParse class is used to interpret parameters passed in to a program from the command line and an arbitrary collection of input files. The parameters are stored in static table that can be queried by any object of type ParmParse. A parameter is a "definition". A definition is of the form "\<name\> = \<value\>\<value\>...\<value\>". It is stored in the table as a name, value-list pair.

In the following example, niter is a definition with the single integer value 10; name is a definition with the string value "big code" and dx is a definition with the two floating point values 0.5 and 0.75 and iv is an IntVect(5,4)

The ParmParse class has two constructors. The first is responsible for building the table and is usually called by the main routine of an application. It has arguments for the command line argc and argv parameters, as well as an optional filename argument for reading definitions from an input file. The table is built by reading the input file first (if it exists) with the command line arguments added to the end of the table. The order of a definition in the table is significant, so command line parameters can be used to override definitions in the input file. A definition of the explicit form: FILE=<filename> is not added to the table but is a directive to include the named file at that point in the table.

The second constructor is generally used by other classes in the code. It permits access to the table via a large collection of query functions. Both constructors have an optional prefix argument that narrows the search to entries in the table with the same prefix. For example, let PlanR be a ParmParse object with code prefix "ope". PlanR.get("val",v) will look for an entry in the parameter list of the form: ope.val==<value>, and will reject all entries not starting with the correct code prefix.

The query functions search the table for definition names that match a given string (and prefix) and return values from the corresponding value list. The values can be returned as ints, Vector<int>s, floats, Vector<float>s, doubles, Vector<double>s, std::strings, or Vector<aSring>s. All values in the table are stored as std::string objects, but if an int, float, or double is requested, the translation is done automatically. In the previous example, the value of niter could be returned as either an std::string, an int, a double, or a float. The values of dx can be returned as std::strings, floats, or doubles, but the value of name can be returned only as an std::string.
Comments in an input file include all text from a # character to the end of the line. Here is a sample input file:

Preprocessing of AMREX_SPACEDIM is supported. It supports #if, #elif, #else, and #endif. The condition must be AMREX_SPACEDIM op D, where op is >, <, >=, <=, or ==, and D is 1, 2, or 3. The parentheses around the condition are optional. Some examples are shown below.
Math expression is supported for integers and reals. For example
becomes
More details can be found at https://amrex-codes.github.io/amrex/docs_html/Basics.html#parmparse
